review: I've been using Google calendar for about 20 years and it really has not had a lot of improvements. It is straightforward but it is not growing with the times.
Overall, my experience is positive as I love the reminders for events that are on the calendar and the ability for others to add to ours from another office.

Overall really like the app and have been using it more and more even in my personal life to keep organized. I like that you can integrate multiple accounts. I do wish it could sync with teams calendar but I don't think that is currently an option.
Overall, Google Calendar is very helpful for my day-to-day work, especially since I have many weekly meetings to manage. The integration with Google Meet is also a big plus for remote meetings.
Overall I enjoy using Google Calendar for work appointments. It helps keeps things organized and visible for me.
I will keep using it because it solves a lot of Microsoft problems for me. I can get it on any device even the internet if I had to. So overall, it is a tool in my toolbox.
Great untill new update, now horrible, will now try and find other options for all google apps.
I began using the google calendar years ago, but have since stopped once I missed a few appointments because it wasnâ€™t signed into the right account.

I may be in the minority here, but I think the interface and usability of Google Calendar is horrible. I find the interface confusing and the mechanism/appearance of invitations and related acceptances terrible. This is consistent with gmail, which I find to be quite counterintuitive as an interface compared to Outlook.
